snippet: Abdullah Abdullah accused his opponent, Ashraf Ghani, and President Hamid Karzai of fraud in the runoff vote, but the next steps are unclear.
abstract: Afghanistan’s presidential election is put into crisis as candidate Abdullah Abdullah announces boycott of the electoral process, accusing opponent Ashraf Ghani and Pres Hamid Karzai of engineering huge fraud in runoff vote; calls on election commission to halt all vote-counting and immediately investigate any inflated ballot totals.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Matthew Rosenberg from the Panjshir Valley, Afghanistan. Haris Kakar and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Abdullah Abdullah accused his opponent, Ashraf Ghani, and President Hamid Karzai of fraud in the runoff vote, but the next steps are unclear.

headline.main: Candidate’s Protest Clouds Afghan Vote-Counting for President
headline.print_headline: Candidate’s Protest Clouds Afghan Vote-Counting for President
